question: On June 2017, the following claim was made: David Lloyd George lost every bid to become prime minister. Was this claim true or false?
rationale: David Lloyd George served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1916 to 1922. He also served as the Chancellor of the Exchequer and the Minister of Munitions before becoming Prime Minister. Therefore, the claim that he lost every bid to become Prime Minister is false.

question: On June 2017, the following claim was made: In 1966, George Harrison got married for the first time. Was this claim true or false?
rationale: George Harrison married his first wife, model Pattie Boyd, on January 21, 1966.

question: On June 2017, the following claim was made: Woodrow Wilson did not live during World War I. Was this claim true or false?
rationale: Woodrow Wilson was the President of the United States during World War I, serving from 1913 to 1921.

question: On April 17 2008, the following claim was made: Hillary Clinton has taken over $800,000 from lobbyists. Was this claim true or false?
rationale: According to OpenSecrets.org, a nonpartisan research group that tracks money in politics, Hillary Clinton received over $800,000 in campaign contributions from lobbyists during her 2008 presidential campaign.
